newsitem.title: USA: US FCC chief praises TV owner for free air time.
newsitem.headline: US FCC chief praises TV owner for free air time.

text.p: Fisher Broadcasting has become the second television operator to offer congressional and gubernatorial candidates free air time, Federal Communications Commission Chairman Reed Hundt said Friday.
The FCC chairman earlier this week disclosed that A.H. Belo Corp had made a similar offer on seven of its TV stations.

"I am pleased to report that the campaign for free time is picking up steam," Hundt said in a speech to the "Children Now Symposium" in Menlo Park, Ca. Excerpts from the speech were released by the FCC here in Washington.
Hundt said Fisher is offering three-minute blocks of time on its TV stations in Seattle and Portland, and 90-second blocks on its radio stations in those cities and in Montana.
